metadata.Title: CVE-2022-26377 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium
metadata.Description:
Inconsistent Interpretation of HTTP Requests ('HTTP Request Smuggling')vulnerability in mod_proxy_ajp of Apache HTTP Server allows an attacker tosmuggle requests to the AJP server it forwards requests to. This issueaffects Apache HTTP Server Apache HTTP Server 2.4 version 2.4.53 and priorversions.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-26377` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

apache2 - 2.4.18-2ubuntu3.17+esm6
apache2-bin - 2.4.18-2ubuntu3.17+esm6
apache2-data - 2.4.18-2ubuntu3.17+esm6
apache2-suexec-custom - 2.4.18-2ubuntu3.17+esm6
apache2-suexec-pristine - 2.4.18-2ubuntu3.17+esm6
apache2-utils - 2.4.18-2ubuntu3.17+esm6
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: apache2 package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.4.18-2ubuntu3.17+esm6').
